secret_rule: Only items that can be typed using only the top row of a QWERTY keyboard can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "peanuts" and "cake".
Can I bring a sandwich to the picnic?
No, you cannot bring a sandwich.
Player: Can I bring cookies to the picnic?
Yes, you can bring cookies.
Player: Can I bring ice cream to the picnic?
No, you cannot bring ice cream.
Player: Can I bring donuts to the picnic?
Yes, you can bring donuts.
Player: Can I bring a pie to the picnic?
No, you cannot bring a pie.
Player: Can I bring muffins to the picnic?
No, you cannot bring muffins.
Player: Can I bring cupcakes to the picnic?
No, you cannot bring cupcakes.
Player: Can I bring crackers to the picnic?
Yes, you can bring crackers.
Player: Can I bring a croissant to the picnic?
No, you cannot bring a croissant.

The rule for the picnic game is that you can only bring items that have a double letter in their names. For example, "peanuts", "cake", "cookies", "donuts", and "crackers" all have double letters, while "sandwich", "ice cream", "pie", "muffins", "cupcakes", and "croissant" do not.
